hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Convergence Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: When 3+ significant catalysts (options expiry >$15B, major exchange product launch, institutional forecast revisions) converge within 5 trading days during neutral regime, realized volatility increases by 40%+ over the following 7 days versus trailing 7-day volatility.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Multiple catalysts create overlapping market impacts that amplify each other. Neutral regimes with low baseline volatility provide maximum amplification potential. Current market has options expiry + Binance launch + forecast revisions = ideal setup.
entry_conditions: 3+ of: large options expiry, infrastructure launch, forecast revisions, regulatory news, macro data release
All catalysts occur within 5 trading days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7-day realized volatility increases 40%+ from pre-catalyst levels
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility remains within 15% of pre-catalyst levels after 7 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility remains suppressed despite multiple catalysts, suggesting market has become desensitized or catalysts offset each other.
